Description: Body fragment of probably Klazomenian pottery transport amphora. Exterior slipped very pale brown (10 YR 8/3); parts of two curving bands in glaze fired light reddish brown-light red (2.5 YR 6/5). White inclusions in the clay.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 58, no. 207 pl. 48)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (JA.112)
